meanings.definition: Adhering strictly to the literal interpretation of something.
meanings.sent1: She had a literalistic approach to reading, always taking words at face value.
meanings.sent2: The literalistic understanding of the text led to confusion among the students.
meanings.sent3: His literalistic view of jokes made him miss the humor in many situations.
meanings.sent4: The literalistic mindset can sometimes hinder creativity and imagination.
meanings.sent5: The literalistic interpretation of the painting failed to capture its deeper meaning.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a literal interpretation of words or actions.
meanings.sent1: The literalistic translation of the ancient text preserved its original meaning.
meanings.sent2: Her literalistic nature made her a reliable source for accurate information.
meanings.sent3: The literalistic response to the metaphor left everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent4: In a world of metaphors, his literalistic approach stood out.
meanings.sent5: The literalistic analysis of the poem focused solely on the surface words.
